Text: the movie file is corrupted! WTF??

No it's not. It simply won't play in Zoomplayer or any other traditional players using traditional codecs. Use VLC, it works fine. I'm still inspecting why this will not work with the traditional codecs, but nonetheless it works with VLC. 

Always, always have VLC installed as a last resort option. If it doesn't play in VLC, then you have a legitimate concern. I hope you didn't delete it, because it looks fucking amazing.
